reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Enhancing the protective environment, access to Child protection, comprehensive GBV support and empowerment for the most vulnerable group through Protection services, livelihood and income-generating opportunities. within widows' camps

description.narrative: MARAM Foundation will continue providing Protection services to the same 13 widow camps (where MF still has approved access to those camps Annex G) and will expand in services in the targeted area to include new GBV and CP activities and integrated ERL services. MF will deliver a strategic and multisectoral, multi-AoR including GBV and CP, Early Recovery and Livelihoods (ERL) clusters at 13 camps located in Syria Cross-border, matching Humanitarian Fund’s (SCHF’s) high priority locations (sub-districts of Dana, Harim) for boys, girls, women, elders and people with disabilities through mobile teams, MF will select project staff to match the BNFs types considering the culture and situation on the ground and try to balance between males and females staff as much as possible. MF was one of the first initiatives that establish and manage IDP camps in NWS. The camp is called “Olive Tree” now is called Atmeh camp. MF carries out different types of projects, including protection, education, food security and livelihoods, camp and shelters, WASH, and non-food distribution. During the years, MF delivered aid to more than 2 million people inside Syria and in the neighbouring countries. Also, MF is equipped with over 7 years of experience in providing protection services (CP, GBV, and general protection). Recently MF had the chance to implement GBV activities in 13 camps for widows, the project funded by CHF and shows a great positive impact on women and girls living in those camps. This project will benefit these high-priority areas by strengthening and enhancing child protection (CP) services, enhancing the quality of gender-based violence (GBV) services, prevent GBV, strengthening community resilience, and reducing socio-economic vulnerabilities. MF will consider Do No harm principles and guidelines and match with the widows' camps context to prevent any further harm. In light of the spread of COVID-19, MF during implementation will take into consideration all prevention procedures, guidelines of COVID-19 using GBVSC toolkit and MF COVID19 policy see (annexe I amp J). The project will be implemented in stages: 1, coordinating with the camp administration in order to secure a place for the project activities that consider the confidentiality amp safety of the activities. If no secured place, MF will create a tent as WGSS amp another one as a CFS in camps. 2, An elected committee of women amp girls including PWDs amp elderly women (in each camp), is going to participate in decision-making to determine the identity of the place, the type of activities, empowerment topics and future modality of their lifestyle. 3, 13 mobile teams in each location will be implementing the project’s activities (Using the Awareness Toolkit, the COVID Guidance and the MampE Toolkit as a reference), each team consists of a case manager (GBV, CP) who will provide CM both in-person and remotely, a PSS worker and female facilitator for each camp, and another male facilitator will be targeting men amp boys who live near the widows' camps, local authorities and councils. also, MF during this project will: provide vocational training and skills development to women in Babysitting and parenting, electronic literacy, knitting wool, manufacturing homemade detergents, sewing, and hairdressing. administering a startup business grant program for women. This project will benefit a total of 25000 individuals in the 13 camps: 6500 girls, 11000 women, 4500 boys, and 3000 men. MF will ensure the participation of all relevant stakeholders at all stages of the operations management cycle. MF will be responsible for the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation (MampE), and closure phases. MF will manage the project, provide the contractual services, ensure the required coordination among clusters, and ensure high-quality results and efficient progress through the provision of capable programmatic specialized
